channel.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
channel.description:
So I made a song pretty recently, and for some reason when I uploaded it to SoundCloud it went from sounding like one of my best tracks so far to sounding like an old grandpa’s fart ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ (The track is called Fall btw)
So here’s the original: https://1drv.ms/u/s!AgE8leg-SEl8iV1hd_KSJoX3J-jU
And then here’s what it sounded like when I uploaded it to SoundCloud: https://soundcloud.com/prysmedm/fall
So yeah, that happened, anybody else experienced this? Any ideas on why it compressed when I uploaded it?

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: Alyen
item.description:
It’s sound like your bass instrument is distorting. It’s true that SC converts(transcode) tracks to mp3 for streaming, but it shouldn’t be distorting. Have you’ve tried re-uploading the track(privately, just to check if the same issue occurs)?

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: PlutoPower
item.description:
Just sounds slightly lower to me.

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
If I remember correctly, SoundCloud does a level adjustment before the encoding to prevent errors caused by 0 dB peaks.

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
blakkaz:

Auxy puts a limiter on your final mix to try and match a mastered track’s volume.

It works pretty well when exporting lossless WAVs, but can often sound pretty poor when converted to mp3.

You want to elaborate on this?

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: Prysm
item.description:
Ah, thanks for the info. That track was my first ever attempt at manual mastering my track so I didn’t know about that.

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
There are some good tips here on improving sound quality of lossy conversions.

As a starting point, I’d pull back the levels on your mix.

Auxy puts a limiter on your final mix to try and match a mastered track’s volume.
It works pretty well when exporting lossless WAVs, but can often sound pretty poor when converted to mp3.

Perhaps consider doing two mixes. One for sale, promo, DJing etc… and one for uploading to social media channels.

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
Yeah, it’s got to get the file small enough to stream, there have to be compromises to make that happen. In this case you have a very wide frequency range which highlights the limitations of the format.

Read full topic

item.title: File compressed after Soundcloud upload?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
Soundcloud converts your file to 128kbps mp3.

Read full topic
